technologies.name: C#
technologies.description: C# is a versatile programming language used for building desktop apps, games (Unity), and enterprise software. Strongly typed, object-oriented, and powerful for Windows environments.
technologies.usage: Enterprise applications, Unity games, backend development

technologies.name: TypeScript
technologies.description: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds types, enabling safer and more maintainable web applications. Highly popular in modern web development.

technologies.name: React.js
technologies.description: React.js is a powerful JavaScript library for building interactive user interfaces. It enables component-based architecture and efficient UI updates.
technologies.usage: Single-page applications, dashboards, modern web apps

technologies.name: Next.js (TypeScript)
technologies.description: Next.js is a React framework that adds server-side rendering, routing, and performance optimizations. Using it with TypeScript improves scalability and maintainability.
technologies.usage: Production websites, SEO-friendly apps, full-stack web apps

technologies.name: HTML
technologies.description: HTML is the backbone of the web. All websites use HTML to structure content and elements.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.description: Python is a versatile scripting language. You mainly write scripts for automation, data processing, or small backend tasks.
technologies.usage: Automation scripts, data processing, simple backend

technologies.name: SQL
technologies.description: SQL is used to manage and query relational databases. It is essential for storing, retrieving, and managing application data.

technologies.name: Flutter
technologies.description: Flutter is a UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

technologies.name: CSS
technologies.description: CSS is used to style web content. From colors to layouts, itâ€™s essential for making web pages visually appealing.

technologies.name: TailwindCSS
technologies.description: TailwindCSS is a utility-first CSS framework that speeds up styling and makes responsive design easy.
technologies.usage: Modern web apps, responsive designs, rapid prototyping

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.description: Bootstrap is a classic CSS framework for building responsive websites quickly with prebuilt components.
technologies.usage: Quick layouts, web apps, landing pages

technologies.name: Sass / SCSS
technologies.description: Sass/SCSS extends CSS with variables, nesting, and reusable styles. Great for larger projects.
technologies.usage: Web projects with complex styling, scalable CSS
